review_title: Felt like dreaming, worth a try.
one_reviews_text:
Amazing experiance with a good story could have been a better ending.

Quality is not the best (but it does make it feel more like a dream)
Super cool consept!

review_title: Give this little gem a whirl!
one_reviews_text: Although the initial video quality at the outset is a bit degraded and pixelated, I found this to be a uniquely enjoyable experience overall as the visuals became steadily more "psychedelic" in nature. The acting is actually competent with the light motif sketch of story engaging. As VR is still in it's infancy as an entertainment and communications medium, it is truly exciting to see what Creative Minds can create with this esoteric "blank canvas". Cheers!
This was very interesting if you want to see something completely new in VR

This short film tries to be arty and sometimes succeeds in it when photographic visuals transform into a kind of abstract paintings and the actors are better than average. But most of the time the visual effects are hammering onto your eyes - too much moving and floating blurriness with a stomach sickening effect. While this might be a desired effect in some movies, here it is only distracting and kept my mind off the story. Thus the scenes felt too long and I just wanted them to proceed.

It is just a story, and short at that, and also the video is not high quality; probably in 2016-2017 that was about as high quality as 180 degree cameras could go for non-multi-million-dollar productions anyway. But the content is so good. Not overly-acted like a lot of the other experiences. Not standard cliche'd scenes. And not "100% cutesy and safe for the family". Pretty much a very good sci-fi-esque short episode. Just watch it already.

Very good, really impressed! Very cool cyber reality type sci-fi short story. Takes a few minutes to set the scene and get things going but well worth sticking with. 

Yes, the video is a bit on the low res side, but what they do with it is very good and quite creative. It's well acted and overall the production quality is good.

This is the sort of thing that makes VR stand out from other story telling mediums. Look forward to seeing what they do next.

This is without a doubt the most amazing non interactive experience I've had so far in VR. The acting was superb and well directed. I loved it. I hope they do more.
You are shuffled between first and third person through a movie with awesome special effects to where you are not sure what is real (in the movie) and what is not. The movement through the video is not disorientating. I can't say more with spoiling it. You just need to try it.
Really - just completely boring.
Hey, the video is immersive and really well done, but... it is too hard to do also italian subtitles?

review_title: I´d say this is just bad
one_reviews_text: But this crap tops off the remainder in this store. Not as bad as ruining electric cars blaming the Kaiser but close enough.
Definately worth a download.  Not much repeatabilty but what is there is very well done

review_title: Stellar SciFi ala Philip K. D(censored)
one_reviews_text: This is an incredibly well constructed science fiction story that impressively makes use of the VR medium. While some may find the "altered states" style visuals throughout the experience, I found that they were well used and quite fitting to the story being told. I'd love to see more immersive content of this caliber! Bravo!

review_title: A glimpse into the future of filmmaking
one_reviews_text: Though the resolution and compression take away from the experience, this is the best example of VR filmmaking I have seen and makes me very excited where the medium will go over the next decade. It is perfectly executed, well written and thought provoking, long after viewing. If you don't need to be hand held through a movie, then ignore the 1 star reviews and enjoy this glimpse into the future of filmmaking.
Starting app, choose subs, loading and then credits.....again and again and again....

Excellent experience in VR, very unique in its genre and very immersive. Stupid people will find it boring (as boring than watching a chess game), other will love it. Tested here on my channel : https://goo.gl/eRTxb4
AAA production values and engaging plot

I normally never write reviews on Oculus (or any platform really) but I was very pleasantly surprised after seeing so many 1-3 star reviews. It was by far the best 360 video I've ever seen (and I've actually paid for couple), with a somewhat similar feel to Black Mirror but with very cool visual effects/filters. Being so close to the characters also makes it feel somewhat like a play as opposed to a movie.
I play a lot of potentially sickening game like Eve Valkyrie, and I'm OK. But here, boy, my head hurted after 2 minutes. The poor quality is hard to bear, and unfortunately, it's a little boring.
Waste of time.  No explanations and no directions.  Uninstalled.
But It's trash :/ sorry I mean just do horror films in vr please
Overall good. However its a generation to soon for this kind of experiances. Screen door effect is ruining it all, its way worse then while playing any games.

Not sure why but this really spoke to me, amazing journey in VR Played it 3 times in a row. I loved the narrative and really connected to the story. It's simplistic and also very deep. Makes you feel like you're there with the characters.  Would love to see more from this developer, bravo.

review_title: Potential, but boring, and my poor eyes!
one_reviews_text:
I found this actually put a bit of a strain on my eyes whilst watching. The low visual quality, OTT effects and the way in which the background 'moves' with bizarre effects attached, come together to form messy and uncomfortable visuals.  

However I can understand others' optimism for this VR genre.  I think a lot of effort went into this piece, and parts of it worked, but overall I found it boring.
Blurry and boring. Extra star for being FREE!

review_title: Great begining to a new genre
one_reviews_text: I have to give this 5 stars.   It wasn't the best movie, nor was it the best VR experience but in terms of non-animated VR movies it is cutting edge.   Great use of the camera and audio to tell the story and really put you up close and personal with the characters.

360 degree 3-D video short. Some interesting video effects, such as an image that fills in as you turn your head and Prizma-style filters applied to a video image. Acting only fair and casting a little too PC for my tastes. Gratuitous use of adult and death themes. I'm sure it's not easy to create a gripping live-action video short, but unfortunately this effort didn't succeed. About halfway through, I found myself waiting for it to be over.
Somehow laggy, but nice project

review_title: only get credits over and over, no game.
one_reviews_text: only get credits over and over, no game. Every time i boot it up, it asks for language, i choose english, i get that really long credits scene and then...back to the language select and the credit scroll again: there is no game.

Alteration piques your interest and ignites your imagination. I didn't know what I was getting into when I started this short film, but I finished with a renewed sense of what VR film has to offer audiences. I am very glad to see this make it to consumers. I hope that other VR films from the Tribeca film festival make the trip as well.
The experience of the video and the visual effects was really cool, Movies 360 have a great future!!, keep working on!

There's some horrific stereo disparity (or something weird) going off that meant I couldn't focus correctly on the image, and it was unconfortable to try and even watch it. Can we stop pretending that "VR video" is a good idea at this point in time?

This was the first thing I have seen in VR that is worthwhile art. I get why it has some bad reviews. If you're idea of good VR is a first person shooter this might not be for you. But I found it weird and compelling and a sign of some great work to come in VR.

This VR 360 movie experience is okay and I gave it 3 stars mostly because it's free and it had an interesting premise.  But look at the resolution on Miyubi compared to this movie.  It's night and day difference.  Miyubi is the future of 360 video, this is the past.  Not only that, but Miyubi has a better story and actors.  But compared to other 360 videos, it does deserve 3 stars because most 360 videos are unfortunately, not very good.

I actually really liked this. It had an original feel to it and I was genuinely interested what was happening and what would come next. The direction was great and starts to show a different type of film making needed for 360. Unfortunately the whole experience is marred by the underlying technology. 360 videos are just not at a stage where they are particularly comfortable or impressive. The resolution is low and it does strain your eyes. 

Overall 5* for the makers / director. 1* for the technology.

I think I only grasped the basics of what I just saw, and can't really describe it beyond "it's the second weirdest thing I've seen in VR to date". I think it's well worth experiencing however. This plays to one of VR's most interesting features - it's ability to transport you to a place you could never see first-hand, and could never get a good sense of from a 2D film. It's probably not for everyone, but I'm personally glad it exists.

Yes, it's blocky and pixelated, but I feel it actually plays into it.

It being obscured and hard to see works with the subject matter of the film itself.

The visuals are a must experience.  This is a great alteration of light and sound that could only be done in VR.

Ambtious and actually somewhat decent idea completly ruined by overacting (seriously guys, student theater actors are usually better then this - the lover girl is the only one who is okaish, main character alejandro - just lol), bad direction choices, bad script, bad writing and uninspired use of VR medium. Regarding technical aspects - the resolution is way to low and color grading is bad and the scale of actors compared to the viewer (who are to small since camera angle position is choosen wrongly) is completly messed up. Typical artsy fartsy student project. It's kinda funny to see the directors name in the title.

Wow.. This was really good. Dont let the reports of disorentation of sounds and images fool you, IMO that is part of the story and is a great experience. These kinds of Phyche & or Psychedellic experiences are more often than not what you bring to the experience and what you percieve. If you find this uncomfortable and disorientating it is because of what is in you, and not what is being presented.

its quite pixelated as other write about (as well missing english subtiles), but used it quite very well too and the visual is great too. This is something a 360 movie should been done in VR. Great work!!!

review_title: A glimpse of future story telling in VR
one_reviews_text:
This is a really impressive short story that is really enhanced though VR.

Technically there are issues as the source material is limited by current poor quality 360 video tech and you get a bit nauseous if you move your head, but I will forgive it as it pushes the boundaries of story telling in VR.

What a captivating experience. It leaves me craving for higher resolution and position tracking but with what is available right now it was really solid. Loved the special effects that allowed me to interact in the film in a limited capacity. Very decent acting as well. Well done!

Not a worthwhile experience, it tries to hard to be arty but ends up completely missing the point, the visuals end up just hurting your eyes, and the story is told very poorly. Not worth a download or your time

any bad reviews on this are not misguided. its a good free experience. its not a game or do we have any interaction in it. its a short film best viewed sitting down. well played out with some known actors in it. a must view.
cuts right to credits. cant even watch it

review_title: Can´t start it. Bug inside this version.
one_reviews_text: No matter what button i press it does not start. PLZ developers have a look into it...
The main video won't play after the subtitle selection. It just says black for 30 seconds and jumps straight to the end credits.
This generation of VR really doesn't do video very well.  Blurry visuals and uninspiring content, couldn't see it through to the end.
worth the price of free. the stereo separation will hurt your eyes though. if the stereo separation issue was fixed it would be a solid 4
It kept my attention and I really enjoyed it! I think the 'horrific stereo disparity' that one reviewer mentioned was on purpose...he was dreaming.
video quality is not that good as usual, so that affects the immersion, but the story is very intesting, I could watch more in of it VR
Story was pretty interesting but the poor resolution and the blurry effect made me feel bit ecky (I have hundreds of hours in VR mind you). It is worth a download though, since it is free
need to get the human scale right, VR porn has nailed it, so you guys should take a leaf out of their book.
Pressed all buttons but it didn't get beyond subtitle selection. No instructions.
This VR experience is ok for what it is. Overall this is like a very very bad Acid trip.
Was doing something in the bg, but nothing more beside it.
If VR doesn't normally give you a headache you'll have one after this.
Intriguing story and well-executed visual effects.

360 pixelized videos makes people hate V.
What a waste of time.
NO THANKS
Very cool. Could benefit from more pronounced 3D and higher res though.
was pretty hard to focus on the image and the story just didnt feel interesting to me
Excellent.  This is what its about
Really enjoyed this, the movie and gaming industry need to check this out!
.. just after i choose language.
Felt like I was on drugs ..will do it again
Loads then crashes when started
"A trip."
so wonderful
Finally a great fiction in VR. I can't to see more of those. Actually, there's not that much of good cinematic piece. This one is definitly on the best, with a great cast and a beautiful narrative.
